sentence.idiomatic: Have you booked the plane tickets to Beijing?
The May holiday is coming up. All hotels have been fully booked.
Tomorrow is his birthday, but we haven't order the birthday cake yet.
If we don't have train tickets, then we can't go to Beijing.
Are you still going to the picnic if it rains tomorrow?
If it's 1500 RMB for three tickets, I'll pay now.
The plane tickets are almost fully booked. You had better book yours earlier.
You had better be more polite. Don't be so outrageous.
I heard it will snow tomorrow. You'd better not go out.
They're notorious liars!
I've made a mistake. I should not consider him a liar.
Do you think he is a big liar?
I'd like to buy two economy tickets.
The first class ticket is too expensive. He wants an economy ticket.
Would you prefer the first class or economy class?
Has Xiao Wang paid for the two plane tickets yet?
If you want to buy first class tickets, you'd better pay now.
Your price is too high. I won't pay.
You made a mistake. This is not my book.
He only bought one plane ticket. I definitely didn't make a mistake.
I didn't say he would come today. Are you making a mistake?
Hi, I called you yesterday to book two plane tickets to Beijing. I'm here to pick them up. Here is the money, 1500rmb.
That's not right. The price is 3000rmb for two tickets to Beijing - 1500rmb each.

No way! Yesterday you told me on the phone that the tickets are 1500rmb for two tickets. You said first class tickets were 1500rmb each and I said that I didn't want first class tickets. I want economy class and you told me the cost was 1500rmb for two.
You are making a mistake. I didn't say that. The seats are almost fully booked, so if you want to get the seats, you'd better pay now.
You are a liar. Look it says 750Rmb per ticket on the price list. This is outrageous! I will not pay you.
